item.description:
I seem to be in a mood for RAW's quirky biographical movies.  One summary of this film says "An intimate portrait of Bill Cunningham, the 80 year old New York Times photographer who for forty years has been riding around New York City on his bicycle, documenting fashion trends on the street by day and New York's social scene at night for his two weekly columns in the Sunday Times. Known and beloved by most New Yorkers, and with an international following in the paper and on-line. Bill has been likened to Garbo in that, until now, no one has known a thing about him. Intensely private, and with an aversion to any kind of recognition."

 

Official site for the film is here:  http://zeitgeistfilms.com/billcunninghamnewyork/

 

Usually RAW's films are at 7:30pm, I will update the week before when the times are posted.  I've set our Meetup time a few minutes before, but if you come on time there are trailers for their coming films.  Here is the RAW site, including reviews of the film:

http://www.realartways.org/cinema.htm#bill-cunningham

Film is 84 minutes long.  Interviewees include Anna Wintour, Michael Kors, and many others in the fashion industry, as well as NYC fashionistas whom Cunningham photographs.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: "Bill Cunningham New York" @ RAW
